p: Also notable was the diminishing intensity of the omega-3 FA (linolenoylglycerol) bis-allylic-CH 2 function resonance in 1H NMR spectra acquired on the heated MRAFO oil ( m, δ = 2.80 ppm), particularly at time points of ≥30 min. As expected, this signal was of only a very low relative intensity in spectra of the unheated MRAFO product in view of its very low content therein [<1% (w/w)].
